name: Mercure Paris Voltaire Quartier Bastille

reviews.text: We chose this hotel as it was part of a recognised chain and we were not disappointed. It's 30 seconds from the tube and a 20 minute walk to Place de la Republique, taxi ride from Gare du Nord is 15 euros. The rooms look newly decorated and are very smart and clean, and have excellent blackout-lined curtaisn for a decent lie-in. The reception staff were very helpful and will store bags on your departure day for as long as needed. Breakfast cost 16 euros so we went out - there are loads of bars and restaurants with a minutes walk for better prices. There's also a 24 hour bar round the corner where we sat and had a couple of late-night cocktails. I would stay here again without hesitation.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: we stayed for three nights and had a great time,the staff are very helpfull and i would stay again at the hotel,very nice room and clean b/fast was very good great spot close ot met and resturants and a big thank you to charles he was very helpfull. thanks again john cannon
reviews.title: great place

reviews.text: This hotel was suggested to us by a local and we could not have been happier. Hotel is modern and clean. Rooms are large with a great ensuite. Breakfast was included and very nice. The entire staff could not have been more helpful. A great hotel/location for any price. Metro stop right outside the door...walking distance to the Bastille. Cant wait to go back again!
reviews.title: Great Location and Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for a weekend in March, 2012 and had a lovely time. The hotel is tastefully decorated, in an ideal location in Paris, and our room was very comfortable. I believe we were in one of the larger rooms in the hotel, which was indeed very spacious and relaxing. Perhaps more importantly, the service was great - they were very helpful and welcoming at the front desk, and they provided a lovely breakfast spread in the mornings.
reviews.title: Relaxing spot with great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A really good hotel all things considered. Ideally located next to the Metro, but food options are not as comprehensive. Customer service is warm and helpful *by Parisian standards*. On my first night I did not have a room available so they reaccomodated me into another hotel. Not very nice, unfortunately but was upgraded to the Superior room for the remainder of my stay. There are a couple of niggles, apparently the air conditioner stops working when one opens the window and then never worked again for the rest of my stay. The hotel did not replenish my free minibar and then charged me when I asked for a refill. And the shower in my room does this weird thing where it's intensely hot for 5 seconds and then warm for a good 30 seconds and then crazily hot again for 5.
reviews.title: Some problems but customer service is good
Too average
reviews.text: All in all, very all over the map, but probably the best hotel I've stayed in in Paris for the price in a while to be very honest.

Although the front desk help were very helpful for Parisian standards and the breakfast was good for the price, the hotel itself wasn't what I expected from Accord at this price range. Definnitely lookig for better options on my next trip to Paris maybe in the same neighborhood.
reviews.title: Excelent hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excelent hotel. Located in front of Voltaire subway, this hotel looks new one, maybe recently refurbish. Room is small, but reasonable for a couple. Free (and good) internet wi-fi.
reviews.title: An Excellent Hotel in a Great Location.

reviews.text: This hotel has some of the friendliest hotel staff I've met anywhere--from the chambermaids to the front desk. They earned this hotel an extra star from what it would otherwise deserve.
reviews.title: 4-stars for excellent customer service
The hotel with the best customer service
reviews.text: I frequent Paris and have stayed in many hotels here over the years. The Mercure is nothing special. It's adequate. And, by Paris standards (which typically means you'll have a VERY small room unless you pay an outrageous amount of money), this place is GOOD.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: In a real Paris neighbourhood

reviews.text: 1. Rooms: Tiny, like most Paris rooms. An aspiration to design. But nothing too original or creative.
reviews.title: Just above standard

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. Bathrooms: Not a lot of amenities. Smallest bathroom I've ever seen anywhere. I'm 6'2", broad shoulders, couldn't turn around in the shower. No joke. But clean. They also hang your towels on a towel warmer, which is nice if you use it. Too bad they don't give you top quality towels.
reviews.title: Better than average for Paris

reviews.text: I was disappointed with this hotel having chosen it for a recent stay in Paris based on reviews and ratings. It is not, in my opnion, a 4 star hotel, more like a 2 star establishment. The rooms are very small, with even smaller bathrooms, and there are no services. Not at all what I was expecting.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: Enjoyed my stay versy much - friendly staff, good breakfast, nice location. very clean and stylish hotel.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2 small points - if you are not active on the wifi it drops the connection within a very short period of time - very annoying to have to regsiter again and again rather than having a password that would bring you back automatically.
reviews.title: A good hotel with great transport links.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: and the bathroom had saloon style doors that clattered nosiily very time you went in and out.. not very nice for your sleeping companion in the night.. I suspect these were in the smaller rooms where I stayed so maybe not a problem in the larger rooms...
reviews.title: A nice hotel in the heart of Paris!

aka: Mercure Paris Voltaire Quartier Bastille Hotel Paris
description: The Hotel Mercure Paris Voltaire Quartier Bastille boasts a contemporary Baroque atmosphere with warm decor and refined style in plum tones. The hotel offers 52 rooms over 8 floors with 2 floors of superior rooms with breathtaking views of Sacré-Coeur. It is located close to the city's hot-spots, Place de la Bastille, the Marais district, Place de la Nation, Père Lachaise Cemetery and the Voltaire metro stop.
